item.title: Report E-2025010076
item.description:
Report E-2025010076

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-08T18:17:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-06
  • City: SCOTT
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding two punctured leaking 55-Gallon DM’s containing hazardous product, EMBR12085A. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 30-Gallon release onto the concrete dock floor in a 10’ x 10’ area as a result of dunnage. The contractor applied oil dry to the release and overpacked both drums into 95-Gallon DF’s. The impacted absorbents, PPE, and pallet pieces were containerized into one 55-gallon DF. All waste was left on-site for XPO to manage. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this response.

item.title: Report E-2025010077
item.description:
Report E-2025010077

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-08T18:17:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-03
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 3, 2024, sixteen (16) pails of paint (gallon and quart) were crushed and released approximately eight (8) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All waste was containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums and nine (9) 5-gallon pails.

item.description:
Report E-2025010079

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-08T18:17:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-27
  • City: MONTEBELLO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 27, 2024, eight (8) 5-gallon pails of paint were crushed and released approximately six (6) gallons of product to the trailer interior and surrounding freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ten West Environmental (TWE) to remediate the impacted site. TWE utilized cleaners and absorbent pads to remove all released paint. All waste was containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025010080
item.description:
Report E-2025010080

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-08T18:17:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-27
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) pint of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to a nail in the trailer that resulted in the drum being punctured. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 65-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: On December 23rd a package was discovered during offloading that had leaked. The package contained UN1170, ethyl alcohol, 3, II, and was marked and labeled appropriately. The package was placed into a steel salvage drum and the shipper contacted to pick up.

item.title: Report E-2025010070
item.description:
Report E-2025010070

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-08T18:17:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-20
  • City: HEBRON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Sun Country Airlines
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FEAM CVG currently operates as contract maintenance for Sun Country Airlines at the CVG airport. On 12/20/2024 Sun Country maintenance control reached out to a FEAM employee to request that a non-hazardous material aircraft part be shipped back to MSP that night as COMAT on board flight 3039 and A/C N7907A. Without the knowledge or consultation of any Sun Country employee the FEAM employee also loaded a single portable halon fire extinguisher (UN1044) which was not declared as hazmat. This undeclared hazmat COMAT was subsequently onboard A/C N7907A for flight 3039 from CVG to MSP. Upon arrival in MSP this hazmat was discovered, and the discrepancy became known. There was no package failure or release of material during this event and the undeclared hazmat package was removed from the aircraft without further incident. Actions taken after this event included reaching out to the contract maintenance provider to remind them any shipping of items as COMAT needs to be communicated too and cleared by the Sun Country materials department. An internal investigation was also launched along with the filing of an FAA hazmat cargo discrepancy report and an FAA VDRP related to the regulatory violation that occurred.

item.description:
Report E-2025010069

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-03
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 3, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of printing ink was forked and released approximately 55-gallons to the dodck floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched crews from First Call Environmental (FCE) and Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. R+L deployed absorbents prior to their arrival. FCE utilized hand tools to collect the absorbents. All UN1210 impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 85-gallon drum, one (1) 55-gallon drum, and four (4) 95-gallon overpacks. TLE personnel aided in transferring all non-damaged product to new, undamaged pallets for continued shipment.

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-03
  • City: BENSALEM
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics contacted ERTS regarding one leaking 55-gallon DM containing hazardous product, RDL44LVOC. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 1-gallon release onto the wooden trailer floor in a 2’ x 3’ area as a result of improper packaging. Oil dry was applied to the release and the damaged, leaking drum was overpacked. Two drums were generated container the overpacked drum of product, the impacted oil dry and the impacted PPE. XPO will manage all waste generated from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report E-2025010054
item.description:
Report E-2025010054

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-23
  • City: EGGENSTEIN GERMANY
  • State:
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: UPS AIRLINES WAS NOTIFIED ONE AIR PACKAGE ORIGINATING FROM CHINA, TRANSITING THROUGH THE USA ON UPS AIRCRAFT HAD BEEN DELIVERED TO THE CONSIGNEE IN GERMANY CONTAINING A TOXIC BY INHALATION LIQUID FORBIDDEN FOR TRANSPORT. THE CONSIGNEE ORDERED CHEMICAL TRIMETHYLSILYLCYANID AT UCHEM INC, SHANGHAI, CHINA. ONCE THE PACKAGE WAS RECEIVED BY THE CONSIGNEE IN GERMANY, THEY DISCOVERED ALL DOCUMENTATION STATED NON-HAZARDOUS CHEMICAL MONOMETHYL ADIPATE HAD BEEN SHIPPED INSTEAD OF THE ORDERED TRIMETHYLSILYLCYANID CHEMICAL. THE TOXIC BY INHALATION LIQUID, FLAMMABLE WAS PACKAGED IN AN ALUMINUM BAG DESCRIBED AS MONOMETHYL ADIPATE CAS 627-91-8. THE OUTER FIBERBOARD BOX WAS NOT MARKED OR LABELLED WITH ANY DANGEROUS GOODS INDICATORS. UPON OPENING THE ALUMIMUM BAG, THE CONSIGNEE NOTED THE SMELL OF CYANIDE. THE 500 G BOTTLE INSIDE THE BAG HAD NO LABELS OR SIGNAGE INDICATING THE CONTENTS INSIDE THE BOTTLE. TESTS PERFORMED BY THE CONSIGNEE CONFIRMED TRIMETHYLSILYL CYANIDE, CAS 7677-24-9 WAS CONTAINED IN THE UNMARKED BOTTLE INSIDE THE ALUMINIM BAG DESCRIBED BY THE SHIPPER AS MONOMETHYL ADIPATE CAS 627-91-8. THE PACKAGE IS NO LONGER IN TRANSPORTATION BUT HAD PREVIOUSLY TRAVELED VIA AIRCRAFT FROM PVG TO ANC, ANC TO SDF, SDF TO CGN.

item.title: Report E-2025010061
item.description:
Report E-2025010061

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-20
  • City: INCHEON KOREA
  • State:
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN INCHEON, KOREA, X-RAY SCREENING OF ONE PACKAGE FROM THE USA TO CHINA WAS FOUND TO CONTAIN TRAYS OF LITHIUM ION BATTERIES. THE OUTER BOX DOES NOT HAVE ANY DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS. THERMAL LABEL AND INVOICE DESCRIBE CONTENTS AS BATTERIES. OPEN PACKAGE INSPECTION TO DETERMINE THE TYPE OF BATTERIES BEING SHIPPED REVEALS TRAYS OF HIGHSTAR 3.6V INR21700 - 40PS 14.4 WH - INR22/71 LI-ION 111824 BATTERIES. PRIOR TO THE UNDECLARED DISCOVERY THE PACKAGE WAS FLOWN ON UPS AIRCRAFT FROM SDF TO ANC, ANC TO ICN.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 20, 2024, at 1402 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner Transportation Services personnel in Romulus, MI regarding the release of Rectorseal SAM CL-3L Cleaner. The spill consisted of approximately 8 ounces of Rectorseal Sam CL-3L Cleaner (UN1993, 3, II), which spilled from 1-1 gallon metal can due to a loose lid during transit. The terminal stated there was no cleanup needed as whatever spilled had already dried up and evaporated upon discovery. Waste disposal is pending a response from the consignee as to whether they will accept the leaking containers or not.

  • Description: At 10:54 ET, XPO notified the Call Center of a cargo release at terminal XSX. It was reported that approximately 2 cups of Sodium hydroxide solid released from two 50-pound bags mesh plastic bags due to improper loading by previous terminal. The release impacted Dock #154. Call center initially advised terminal personnel they were able to clean up the spilled product due to initial overlooking of section 14 of the SDS. Upon further review of the SDS it was discovered that the material was class 8 corrosive, terminal was called and informed of the product classification, the call center was notified that the product had already been cleaned and stored away in a 10-gallon plastic drum. Service Center Manager was informed of the mistake and gave retroactive approval for terminal personnel to clean the spilled product. Waste label 223160-1 was created, one 10-gallon poly drum containing the cleaned-up product and two plastic mesh bags.

  • Description: At 02:06 on 12/10, XPO-NWN contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 2 quarts of "Gardoclean S 5661" from a 54gal poly drum impacting the trailer floor. The drum was punctured by a forklift at BCO. ERTS confirmed the material to be a regulated corrosive and will dispatch a contractor to assist with cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of UN3266 Gardoclean released due to forklift puncture. The product impacted the wooden trailer floor 10’x7’ and concrete floor 10’x’8’. The contractor used citric acid to neutralize the release and used oil dri, absorbent pads, and boom to contain/clean-up the release. The contractors containerized impacted absorbent into (1) 55-gallon poly drum, impacted absorbents & PPE into (1) 55-gallon poly drum and overpack into (1) 85-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 15:40 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (UTA) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to improper loading, approximately 3 gallons of Klean Strip Acetone (hazardous - UN1090) was released on the trailer; and 9 cans of Fuel -Denatured Alcohol (hazardous - UN1987) was refused by the Consignee. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product and 4 damaged cans of UN1090 - Acetone will be placed into a 20-gallon metal drum, while the 9 cans of UN1987 - Denatured Alcohol will be placed into a 35-gallon metal drum, and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release. There is no regulatory reporting required for this release. ERTS will upload the BOL, SDS and create a waste container entry.

item.description:

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 24500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 14:57 PM ET, UDV contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred over the road, near 5500 Lincoln St. in Denver, CO. The spill consists of approximately 75 gallons of a UN1719 corrosive liquid, trade name unknown, which spilled from 1-270 gallon plastic tote. The driver was cut off by another vehicle and had to make a sharp turn, causing the tote to suffer a large puncture across the middle. The driver stated the tote was properly secured and strapped in, and they believe the spill was due to package failure. The spill has impacted the floor of the trailer and has spilled out onto the asphalt below the trailer. The tote is no longer actively leaking. ERTS will dispatch for assistance. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 250-gallons of UN1719 product released to a 180’x20’ area of the trailer floor, asphalt, concrete and drain due to load shift. The contractors cleaned the release with absorbents, recollected, and containerized the release into drums, (2) CUYD containing floor dry impacted with product, (2) 275-gallon totes containing impacted rinsewater from the drains, (2) 55-gallon plastic drums containing transferred product only, (1) 55-gallon plastic drum contained impacted PPE, debris, poly sheeting, floor dry, spent absorbents and straps and (1) 65-gallon metal drum containing impacted absorbents, trash bags, and PPE and (2) 55-gallon plastic drums containing cut up totes. The waste was picked up and taken to a waste management facility.

It was reported that due to improper loading, 1–3-gallon metal pail of UN1263, Masterpro refinishing General purpose lacquer thinner was damaged resulting in the release of 3 oz of product to the body of the pail. ERTS reviewed the SDS with XPO, who confirmed terminal personnel were comfortable and capable of cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per the SDS. The impacted pail was containerized into (1) 4-gallon metal drum.

item.title: Report E-2025010040
item.description:
Report E-2025010040

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-04
  • City: SALEM
  • State: IL

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 2338 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at XSW. It was reported that approximately 1 teaspoon of FOA-3 released from a 55-gallon DF due to defective caps at the top of the drum. The release impacted the top of the drum only inside of trailer #3193592 and is staged in the yard. The Contractor recovered the “FOA-3” UN 2264 with chemical wipes and oil dry. 1-85 overpack and 1-35 DF were generated. The contractor left all waste onsite for terminal management to handle properly.

  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the concrete terminal floor and estimated that three (3) ounces of material was released due to a defective weld seam on one (1) 275-gallon metal tote. Hepaco personnel stated that granular absorbents had been applied and slightly impacted. The impacted absorbents were collected and taken offsite for Hepaco to dispose of. The remaining product was transferred to a new tote.

  • Description: On December 30, 2024, one (1) 50-gallon drum of UN1760 was damaged by a forklift and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the pallet and trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew containerized the damaged drum in one (1) 95-gallon overpack. FCE utilized granular absorbents and hand tools to remediate the surfaces and collected all waste in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

  • Description: Upon arrival at the destination terminal, the pail was discovered leaking inside the trailer. The pails on the skid were secured using a dunnage pallet but during transit, the dunnage pallet moved slightly, allowing the pail to fall off of the skid it was sitting on. As a result, the bottom of the pail cracked causing a small release of material. The material was absorbed using absorbent material and placed into a proper receptable along with the damaged pail for proper disposal. The package specifications were not able to be safely obtained.

item.title: Report E-2025010036
item.description:
Report E-2025010036

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T00:58:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-17
  • City: HUBER HEIGHTS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to a packaging defect that resulted in the drum leaking. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into two (2) 5-gallon poly drums. One (1) 85-gallon poly drum was used to containerize the 55-gallon drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

It is unclear if the drum was damaged from a protruding nail in the skid or if it was a structural defect. The released material and damaged container were immediately cleaned up and placed into a container for proper disposal. Due to the hazard of material, the packaging specs were not able to be obtained.

item.description:

  • City: POMPANO BEACH

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 07:14 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (NPB) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to improper loading, approximately 5 pounds Royal Blend NP AE (hazardous - UN3262) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer and dock floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS (Nick Fletcher - Service Center Mgr. was advised the terminal wants to clean it themselves). The released product and damaged bag will be placed into a 5-gallon poly drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

item.title: Report X-2025010033
item.description:
Report X-2025010033

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T00:58:33+00:00

  • City: LYNNFIELD
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED, PALED AND SORTED TO THE NORTH SORT AISLE. THE SORTER NOTICED A SMALL AMOUNT OF LIQUID COMING OUT FROM THE CORNER OF THE BOX. HE LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. THE SUPERVISOR THEN CALLED FOR A DESIGNATED RESPONDER. THE RESPONDER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET PLACED THE LEAKING PACKAGE INTO A LINED SPILL TUB. THE RESPONDER THEN FOLLOWING THE EQUIPMENT DECONTAMINATION CHECKLIST DECONTAMINATED THE EQUIPMENT. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. IT WAS THERE THE PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED TO BE UNDECLARED.

item.description:
Report E-2024120463

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-01T21:13:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-28
  • City: GLENPOOL
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO in Glenpool, OK contacted ERTS regarding a leaking 300-gallon plastic tote containing IMAGE NO. 186 (Nitric Acid). A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 2-CUPS of released product onto the wooden trailer in floor and the top of the tote itself in a 2'x2' area. The cap to the tote was defective causing the spill. The contractor neutralized the release using sodium bicarbonate and replaced the broken cap. One drum of waste was generated containing the impacted and neutralized PPE and absorbents. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-01T21:13:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-26
  • City: ONTARIO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ONE AIR PACKAGE SHIPPED FROM DORAL, FL AND DESTINED FOR HUNTINGTON BEACH, CA WAS DISCOVERED ON 26-DEC-2024 TO BE EXPERIENCING A BATTERY THERMAL EVENT IN A TRAILER AT 2925 E JURUPA STREET IN ONTARIO, CA 91761. THE DISCOVERY OCCURRED DUE TO VISIBLE SMOKE WITHIN THE TRAILER. THE FIRE SELF-EXTINGUISHED, AND BURNED A HOLE IN THE SIDE OF THE PACKAGE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS, IT WAS DISCOVERED (3) LUMINOUS PRO 2 LED POWER BANKS WERE IN THE PACKAGE. THE PACKAGE POSSESSED NO DG MARKS, LABELS, OR SHIPPING PAPERS DECLARING THE DISCOVERED LITHIUM ION BATTERIES. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING SHIPPER NUMBER H9199D, ACTIVATESWAG, 3200 NW 112TH AVE C4, DORAL FL 33172-5013.

item.title: Report E-2024120448
item.description:
Report E-2024120448

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-01T21:13:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-26
  • City: GARLAND
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 26, 2024, LGT notified ERTS of a spill that occurred inside of a trailer and on the dock in Garland, TX. The spill consisted of approximately half a quart of UN1824 Trupower All Purpose Dishmachine Detergent, which spilled from a box containing a 5-gallon plastic jug. The jug was damaged due to the shipper loading the box containing the jug too closely to another pallet, which punctured the container and caused it to leak out onto the trailer floor and on the dock as well. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who turned down contractor assistance. Terminal personnel donned PPE and contained and cleaned the release. The damaged jug and impacted absorbents were placed into a 10-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 24, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3214 had faulty packaging during shipping and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration (ER) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remove all product from the trailer. All impacted waste and the damaged pail were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

The commercial invoice stated this was Sodium Hydroxide and due to past shipments that have been undeclared the package was opened to discover that it contained UN1823, Sodium Hydroxide, Solid, 8, II. The package has been held pending FAA investigation.

  • Description: On 12/24/2024 at approximately 1530, Dangerous Goods Administration received notification from Employee 5264740 at the hub facility in Guangzhou, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box, containing four glass bottles. The shipment is damaged by a forklift, resulting in spillage of one of the bottles. Due to the international location, the shipment was sent for disposal and the shipper was notified.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 12/18/2024, at approximately 1400 hours, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 658069 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of 19 fiberboard boxes, each presumably containing 4 glass bottles. One of boxes appeared to have been damaged, showing wet spots on the outer packaging. Further investigation revealed that 2 of the 4 bottles in the package were broken, resulting in spillage. The cause is the damage is unknown. The remaining 18 packages were moved forward in transit and the damaged package was placed in a salvage drum and hazardous disposal.

item.description:

  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (XKC) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to a forklift accident, a 55-gallon poly drum was knocked over and released approximately 2 quarts of UN1903 ChemSan 1400. XPO stated that the released product was contained to the dock floor at door #103. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who turned down contractor assistance. Terminal personnel donned PPE and contained and cleaned the release. The drum was up-righted and the lid of the drum was re-secured for the drums continued shipmen on. The impacted absorbents used to clean the spill were containerized into a 10-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: Carus Corporation contacted ERTS requesting assistance with retorquing 95-5 gallon jerricans containing UN3214 Organic Peroxide CIRCUSPOSIT 3308A 51. It was reported that 3-4 of the pails were leaking due to loose caps. Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Four jerricans were identified as leaking. The caps were tightened and tested for leakage. Clean Harbors wiped down the impacted jerricans, but was unable to tighten one Jerrican cap. The impacted pallet, rags, and damaged jerrican were containerized into two, 55-gallon poly drums for proper disposal.

item.description:

  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 9000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1751 ET, Drew Rechenmacher with XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal BIN. It was reported that an unknown amount of UN1050 Hydrogen Cloride released from cylinder due to lose valve. The release impacted trailer # 3191604. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. ERTS will proceed to dispatch a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. The Contractor tested the air in the trailer with an air meter, colorimetric (Draeger) detection tubes, and a series of pH strips in various sections of the trailer. No waste was generated.

  • Description: At 16:34 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (XEL) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to a forklift puncture, approximately 5 gallons of Armorflex (White) - (Hazardous - UN1866) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product, 2 damaged drums, and oil-dri will be placed into 2 separate drums (a 65-gallon metal drum and a 65-gallon poly drum) and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release. There is no regulatory reporting required for this release.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000

  • Description: At 0651 ET, XPO-XCL notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately 1 cup of Ammonium Hydrogendifluoride released from a plastic bag due to the bag ripping from underneath the pallet. The release impacted the concrete dock. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. A contractor was dispatched and observed an estimated 0.5lb release onto the concrete dock floor in a 2’x2’ area as a result of dunnage. The contract used a HEPA Vac to clean-up the release. The spill product, overpacked damaged bag, impacted PPE, and HEPA Vac filter were containerized into one 55-gallon DF for waste disposal. XPO will manage all waste generated by the incident. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil was involved in this incident.
